author: Simon Rice
title: Wayne Rooney move from Manchester United to Everton ‘likely to happen’
text:
Rooney has become a peripheral figure at Old Trafford this season (Getty) A move this summer that will see Wayne Rooney leave Manchester United and return to Everton is â€˜likely to happenâ€™, according to reports.
The England captain has been strongly linked with an exit from Old Trafford this season having been relegated to a bit-part player under Jose Mourinho.
Transfer targets to deadwood: How Arsenal could line up next season amid talk of overhaul The 31-year-old has been linked with various clubs, however it seems a return to Goodison Park is growing increasingly likely.
The Independent claim unnamed sources close to Everton and Manchester United think the deal will happen.
Itâ€™s suggested that Manchester United could even be willing to waive a fee, despite him having a contract until 2019. Rooneyâ€™s huge wages â€“ approximately ÂŁ300,000-a-week â€“ may play a part in that stance considering he is hardly playing.
Rooney came close to a move to China last month (Getty) He is Manchester United’s all-time leading scorer (Getty) West Ham have also been linked and could yet rival Everton, who are ready to offer Rooney around ÂŁ150,000-a-week. A big offer from the London club could turn Rooneyâ€™s head, however he is currently leaning towards the Merseyside club at which he started his career.

Rooney has also been linked with the MLS and the Chinese Super League. However with the 2018 World Cup looming heâ€™s keen to remain in the Premier League and in Gareth Southgateâ€™s thinking.
